answers.text:
Other communities do.  These two blog posts provide some summary information of how, plus links to resources that can probably give you more direct examples:   http://www.smartincentives.org/blogs/blog/9540313-incentives-linked-to-sustainability-outcomes  and  http://www.smartincentives.org/blogs/blog/14148129-financing-incentives-for-sustainability-priorities . This blog post from the ICMA Sustainable Communities may also be helpful:  http://icma.org/en/results/sustainable_communities/resources/blogpost/2380/Sustainability_and_Incentives_Using_the_Triple_Bottom_Line_Tool

answers.author: David Thurnau
answers.text:
Hello Marcos,
Though I don't have any resources specific to your question,  I did want to make you aware that our company, Community Green Energy, is currently looking to work with cities to develop community solar projects, especially in Ohio.  It's a little different form of economic development, as it is designed to keep money within the community, though it also creates construction jobs, and I have attached a document that explains it a little further.  If you're interested, I'd be happy to talk with you about it, just contact me a dthurnau@theadmincenter.com.

answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
Marcos, I'm a little to the dance on this question but it is a good one.  You might want to check out the International Economic Development Council website because it does have a focus on trends in "green" oriented development.  Also, many traditional economic development program tool boxes are now including green energy/sustainability companies as a focus for traditional incentive packages.

author: Marcos Nichols
text: The City of Hamilton already offers the traditional economic development incentives (expedited permitting/waiver, tax incentives, loan incentives, as well as training incentives) and we are simply looking to see if any community has implemented unique economic development tools/incentives for “green energy/sustainability” companies.
title: Economic Development Incentives for "Green Energy/Sustainability" Companies
